question: Which sports journalist  is the author of the book “The Fire Burns Blue: A History of Women's Cricket in India”?
explanation: The book, titled \'The Fire Burns Blue: A History of Women\'s Cricket in India\', is co-authored by sports journalists Karunya Keshav and Sidhanta Pathak. This is the first comprehensive history of women\'s cricket that documents the entire gamut of the women\'s game starting from its humble beginnings, its spirited journey through its early years to the present-day when truly, the game has come of age. It talks about the numerous \"twist and turns\" of women\'s cricket, including the early days of pioneers like Diana Eduljee and Shantha Rangaswamy in the early \'70s and the stars of today like Mithali Raj and Harmanpreet Kaur. The book will be launched as part of the publishing house\'s new imprint, Westland Sport on November 30, 2018.
